resources.string: Wearing protective masks when going to ocrowded place. If you are healthy, you only need to wear a mask if you are taking care of a person with suspected 2019-nCoV infection
Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the bathroom, before eating, and after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing
Cover your nose and mouth with a disposable tissue or flexed elbow when you cough or sneeze
Some foods require washing. Produce with a lot of nooks and crannies like cauliflower, broccoli or lettuce should be soaked for 1 to 2 minutes in cold clean water
If soap and water are not readily available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitiser with at least 60% alcohol. Always wash hands with soap and water when hands are visibly dirty
Stay home and self-isolate from others in the household if you feel unwell
Social distancing is important because coronavirus spreads when an infected person coughs small droplets - packed with the virus - into the air
If you have a fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical attention and go to doctor immediately
Don\'t contact the animal. Avoid close contact (1 meter or 3 feet) with people who are unwell and animals
Avoid touching your face eyes, nose, and mouth
Avoiding crowded public places. That means avoiding sick people, steering clear of crowds, staying home as much as possible, and keeping at least 6 feet away from others when you do go out
